problem: Express the value of the following expression as a fraction. $$1+\cfrac{2}{3+\cfrac{4}{5}}$$
chatgpt_solution:
To compute this value, we should first look at the inner part of the expression $\frac{4}{5}$. This is a "quantity," which means it evaluates to some number. Next, we look at the expression $3+\frac{4}{5}$. This can be simplified by adding $\frac{3}{1}$ and $\frac{4}{5}$. Finding a common denominator, we have \begin{align*}
3+\frac{4}{5}&=\frac{15}{5}+\frac{4}{5}\\
&=\frac{19}{5}.
\end{align*} Now, we need to look at the expression $1+\frac{2}{3+\frac{4}{5}}$. Similarly, to simplify $\frac{2}{3+\frac45}$, we need to find a common denominator again. We have \begin{align*}
1+\frac{2}{3+\frac{4}{5}} &=1+\frac{2}{\frac{15}{5}}\\
&=1+\frac{2}{\frac{15}{5}}\cdot\frac{5}{5}\\
&=1+\frac{2\cdot 5}{15}\\
&=1+\frac{10}{15}.
\end{align*} Simplifying this once more by finding a common denominator, we find \begin{align*}
1+\frac{10}{15}&=1+\frac{10\cdot 1}{15\cdot 1}\\
&=1+\frac{10}{15}\\
&=1+\frac{2}{3}\\
&=\boxed{\frac{5}{3}}.
\end{align*}
